Train/test split by cluster for GMERT data

split_gmert_data.Rd

Splits a clustered dataset into training and test sets while preserving the cluster structure. Each cluster contributes the same proportion of observations to the training and test sets.

Usage

split_gmert_data(df, train_prop = 0.7, seed = 123)

Arguments

df

A data.frame containing clustered observations. Must include a column named id.

train_prop

Numeric. Proportion of observations per cluster to use for training.

seed

Integer. Random seed for reproducibility.

Value

A list with two elements:

train

Training data.frame

test

Test data.frame

See also

Other gmert: fit_gmerf_small(), fit_gmert(), fit_gmert_small(), predict_gmert(), sim_data_gmert()

Examples

data <- sim_data_gmert()
split <- split_gmert_data(data)
nrow(split$train)
#> [1] 1400
nrow(split$test)
#> [1] 600
